info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 8:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CUMBERLAND...NORTHWESTERN AMELIA AND NORTHWESTERN POWHATAN COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 810 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sheppards to near Morven. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cumberland, Sunnyside, and Guinea Mills around 815 PM EDT. Tobaccoville around 820 PM EDT. Ballsville around 825 PM EDT. Trenholm around 840 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Hatchers, Raines Tavern, Trents Mill, Angola, Ashby, Oak Forest, Provost, Rodophil, McRae, and Clinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
